page.title: 02Weston Church
page.content: Weston Lullingfield was until 1857 part of the parish of Baschurch. In that year a church was opened and Weston Lullingfield became a parish on its own. The church had seating for 150 and was dedicated to the Holy Trinity. A clock was put up in 1897 to celebrate Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee. There was a Methodist Chapel at Weston Common, built about 1851. This has now been demolished. Since 1982, the parish has been united with the parishes of Baschurch and Hordley. Together, they cover about 30 square miles. The church is built of sandstone, comprising nave, chancel and roof spire in its own burial ground.
